question: A.7 [1.0 point] The delayed neutron precursor (β) for U²³⁵ is 0.0065. However, when calculating reactor parameters you use β_eff with a value of ~0.0070. Why is β_eff larger than β?

answers.answer: a. Delayed neutrons are born at higher energies than prompt neutrons resulting in a greater worth for the neutrons.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REFERENCE: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, © 1988, § 3.2.4m p. 3-12.

answers.answer: b. Delayed neutrons are born at lower energies than prompt neutrons resulting in less leakage during slowdown to thermal energies.
answers.feedback: Correct. REFERENCE: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, © 1988, § 3.2.4m p. 3-12.

answers.answer: c. The fuel also contains U²³⁸ which has a relatively large β for fast fission.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REFERENCE: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, © 1988, § 3.2.4m p. 3-12.

answers.answer: d. U²³⁶ in the core becomes Pu²³⁹ (by neutron absorption), which has a higher β for fission.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REFERENCE: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, © 1988, § 3.2.4m p. 3-12.
